text: Botswana competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Botswana entered three swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|James Freeman |align=left|200 m freestyle |colspan=2| |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|400 m freestyle |4:00.48 |39 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Adrian Robinson |align=left|50 m breaststroke |29.11 |51 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:04.26 |60 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font- size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left|Naomi Ruele |align=left|50 m freestyle |colspan=2| |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Botswana at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Botswana at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
